manifestVersion.description: The version of the manifest schema this manifest is using.

version.description: The app version. Changes to the app should cause a version change. This version string must follow the semver standard.

id.description: A unique identifier for this app. The id must use reverse domain name notation.

name.description: The display name for the developer.

websiteUrl.description: The url to the developer's website.

privacyUrl.description: The url to the developer's privacy policy.

termsOfUseUrl.description: The url to the developer's terms of use.

name.description: The display name of the app.

short.description: A short description of the app used when space is limited. Maximum length is 80 characters.

full.description: The full description of the app. Maximum length is 256 characters.

icons.description: Each icon image file must be a transparent PNG, with a white or light-colored background.

44.description: An icon for the app sized to 44x44.

88.description: An icon for the app sized to 88x88.

accentColor.description: A color to use in conjunction with the app's icons. The value must be a valid HTML color code starting with '#', for example `#4464ee`.

configUrl.description: The url to use when configuring the tab.

canUpdateConfig.description: A value indicating whether an instance of the tab's config can be updated by the user after creation.

items.description: Specifies whether the tab offers an experience in the context of a channel in a team, a chat between one or more people, or an experience scoped to an individual user alone. These options are non-exclusive

entityId.description: A unique identifier for the entity which the tab displays.

name.description: The display name of the tab.

contentUrl.description: The url which points to the entity UI to be displayed in the Teams canvas.

websiteUrl.description: The url to point at if a user opts to view in a browser.

items.description: Specifies whether the tab offers an experience in the context of a channel in a team, a chat between one or more people, or an experience scoped to an individual user alone. These options are non-exclusive

mri.description: A unique identifier for the bot that matches its ID in the bot framework.

items.description: Specifies whether the bot offers an experience in the context of a channel in a team, a chat between one or more people, or an experience scoped to an individual user alone. These options are non-exclusive

needsIdentity.description: A value indicating whether the app is requesting access to identity information

validDomains.description: A list of valid domains from which the app expects to load any content. Domain listings can include wildcards, for example `*.example.com`. If your tab configuration or content UI needs to navigate to any other domain besides the one use for tab configuration, that domain must be specified here.
